intro: Dianthus anatolicus var. anatolicus, commonly known as the Anatolian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are borne on slender stems and are often clustered in racemes, adding ornamental value to gardens. This species is valued for its resilience and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
